articles.title: Let's Measure the Elephant in the Room: Facilitating Personalized Automated Analysis of Privacy Policies at Scale
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14214v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In modern times, people have numerous online accounts, but they rarely read the Terms of Service or Privacy Policy of those sites despite claiming otherwise. This paper introduces PoliAnalyzer, a neuro-symbolic system that assists users with personalized privacy policy analysis. PoliAnalyzer uses Natural Language Processing (NLP) to extract formal representations of data usage practices from policy texts. In favor of deterministic, logical...
articles.author: Rui Zhao, Vladyslav Melnychuk, Jun Zhao, Jesse Wright, Nigel Shadbolt
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14214v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In modern times, people have numerous online accounts, but they rarely read the Terms of Service or Privacy Policy of those sites despite claiming otherwise. This paper introduces PoliAnalyzer, a neuro-symbolic system that assists users with personalized privacy policy analysis. PoliAnalyzer uses Natural Language Processing (NLP) to extract formal representations of data usage practices from policy texts. In favor of deterministic, logical...

articles.title: NIH scientists pioneer promising treatment for intractable cancer pain
articles.description: RTX is a non-addictive pain therapy derived from a cactus-like plant.
articles.content: RTX is a non-addictive pain therapy derived from a cactus-like plant.

articles.title: NIH study links particulate air pollution to increased mutations in lung cancers among nonsmokers
articles.description: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.
articles.content: Whole-genome sequencing study found air pollution to cause more cancer-related changes than secondhand smoke.

articles.title: The Free Will Equation: Quantum Field Analogies for AGI
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14154v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) research traditionally focuses on algorithms that optimize for specific goals under deterministic rules. Yet, human-like intelligence exhibits adaptive spontaneity - an ability to make unexpected choices or free decisions not strictly dictated by past data or immediate reward. This trait, often dubbed "free will" in a loose sense, might be crucial for creativity, robust adaptation, and avoiding ruts in...
articles.author: Rahul Kabali
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14154v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial General Intelligence (AGI) research traditionally focuses on algorithms that optimize for specific goals under deterministic rules. Yet, human-like intelligence exhibits adaptive spontaneity - an ability to make unexpected choices or free decisions not strictly dictated by past data or immediate reward. This trait, often dubbed "free will" in a loose sense, might be crucial for creativity, robust adaptation, and avoiding ruts in...

articles.title: NIH to Fund Long-Term Health Studies for East Palestine After Train Disaster
articles.description: The 2023 derailment involved 38 cars carrying hazardous chemicals
articles.content: The 2023 derailment involved 38 cars carrying hazardous chemicals

articles.title: NIH to crack down on excessive publisher fees for publicly funded research

articles.content: Effort is part of NIH’s ongoing commitment to scientific transparency and responsible stewardship of taxpayer dollars.

articles.title: Google’s Gemini 2.5 Can Now Identify Very Specific Parts of an Image
articles.description: The company has introduced conversational image segmentation capabilities in its AI models. The post Google’s Gemini 2.5 Can Now Identify Very Specific Parts of an Image appeared first on Analytics India Magazine.
articles.author: Supreeth Koundinya
articles.content: The company has introduced conversational image segmentation capabilities in its AI models. The post Google’s Gemini 2.5 Can Now Identify Very Specific Parts of an Image appeared first on Analytics India Magazine.

articles.title: Scientists identify diagnostic aid to determine risk of diabetic foot ulcer recurrence
articles.description: NIH-funded project shows that trans-epidermal water loss could indicate if wounds are fully healed.
articles.content: NIH-funded project shows that trans-epidermal water loss could indicate if wounds are fully healed.

articles.title: From Bias to Behavior: Learning Bull-Bear Market Dynamics with Contrastive Modeling
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14182v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Financial markets exhibit highly dynamic and complex behaviors shaped by both historical price trajectories and exogenous narratives, such as news, policy interpretations, and social media sentiment. The heterogeneity in these data and the diverse insight of investors introduce biases that complicate the modeling of market dynamics. Unlike prior work, this paper explores the potential of bull and bear regimes in investor-driven market dynamics....
articles.author: Xiaotong Luo, Shengda Zhuo, Min Chen, Lichun Li, Ruizhao Lu, Wenqi Fan, Shuqiang Huang, Yin Tang
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14182v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Financial markets exhibit highly dynamic and complex behaviors shaped by both historical price trajectories and exogenous narratives, such as news, policy interpretations, and social media sentiment. The heterogeneity in these data and the diverse insight of investors introduce biases that complicate the modeling of market dynamics. Unlike prior work, this paper explores the potential of bull and bear regimes in investor-driven market dynamics....

articles.title: NIH scientists test in an animal model a surgical technique to improve cell therapy for dry AMD
articles.description: The technique may enable higher doses and combinations of cell therapies.
articles.content: The technique may enable higher doses and combinations of cell therapies.

articles.title: Breast cancer risk in younger women may be influenced by hormone therapy
articles.description: NIH study could help to guide clinical recommendations for hormone therapy use among women under 55 years old.
articles.content: NIH study could help to guide clinical recommendations for hormone therapy use among women under 55 years old.

articles.title: Predictive Representativity: Uncovering Racial Bias in AI-based Skin Cancer Detection
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14176v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) systems increasingly inform medical decision-making, yet concerns about algorithmic bias and inequitable outcomes persist, particularly for historically marginalized populations. This paper introduces the concept of Predictive Representativity (PR), a framework of fairness auditing that shifts the focus from the composition of the data set to outcomes-level equity. Through a case study in dermatology, we evaluated...
articles.author: Andr\'es Morales-Forero (Polytechnique Montr\'eal), Lili J. Rueda (Universidad El Bosque), Ronald Herrera (Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH), Samuel Bassetto (Polytechnique Montr\'eal), Eric Coatanea (Tampere University)

articles.title: NIH researchers identify brain circuits responsible for visual acuity
articles.description: Studies demonstrate the effect of retinal injury on visual processing pathways, providing insights for the development of vision restoration therapies.

articles.title: Feature Bank Enhancement for Distance-based Out-of-Distribution Detection
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14178v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is critical to ensuring the reliability of deep learning applications and has attracted significant attention in recent years. A rich body of literature has emerged to develop efficient score functions that assign high scores to in-distribution (ID) samples and low scores to OOD samples, thereby helping distinguish OOD samples. Among these methods, distance-based score functions are widely used because of their...

articles.title: Semi-Supervised Federated Learning via Dual Contrastive Learning and Soft Labeling for Intelligent Fault Diagnosis
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14181v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Intelligent fault diagnosis (IFD) plays a crucial role in ensuring the safe operation of industrial machinery and improving production efficiency. However, traditional supervised deep learning methods require a large amount of training data and labels, which are often located in different clients. Additionally, the cost of data labeling is high, making labels difficult to acquire. Meanwhile, differences in data distribution among clients may also...
articles.author: Yajiao Dai, Jun Li, Zhen Mei, Yiyang Ni, Shi Jin, Zengxiang Li, Sheng Guo, Wei Xiang

articles.title: Retention analysis of edited knowledge after fine-tuning
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14198v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) store vast amounts of knowledge, which often requires updates to correct factual errors, incorporate newly acquired information, or adapt model behavior. Model editing methods have emerged as efficient solutions for such updates, offering localized and precise knowledge modification at significantly lower computational cost than continual training. In parallel, LLMs are frequently fine-tuned for a wide range of...
articles.author: Fufang Wen, Shichang Zhang
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14198v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) store vast amounts of knowledge, which often requires updates to correct factual errors, incorporate newly acquired information, or adapt model behavior. Model editing methods have emerged as efficient solutions for such updates, offering localized and precise knowledge modification at significantly lower computational cost than continual training. In parallel, LLMs are frequently fine-tuned for a wide range of...

articles.title: Catalyst: a Novel Regularizer for Structured Pruning with Auxiliary Extension of Parameter Space
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14170v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Structured pruning aims to reduce the size and computational cost of deep neural networks by removing entire filters or channels. The traditional regularizers such as L1 or Group Lasso and its variants lead to magnitude-biased pruning decisions, such that the filters with small magnitudes are likely to be pruned. Also, they often entail pruning results with almost zero margin around pruning decision boundary, such that tiny perturbation in a...
articles.author: Jaeheun Jung, Donghun Lee
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14170v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Structured pruning aims to reduce the size and computational cost of deep neural networks by removing entire filters or channels. The traditional regularizers such as L1 or Group Lasso and its variants lead to magnitude-biased pruning decisions, such that the filters with small magnitudes are likely to be pruned. Also, they often entail pruning results with almost zero margin around pruning decision boundary, such that tiny perturbation in a...

articles.title: IPPRO: Importance-based Pruning with PRojective Offset for Magnitude-indifferent Structural Pruning
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14171v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: With the growth of demand on neural network compression methods, the structured pruning methods including importance-based approach are actively studied. The magnitude importance and many correlated modern importance criteria often limit the capacity of pruning decision, since the filters with larger magnitudes are not likely to be pruned if the smaller one didn't, even if it is redundant. In this paper, we propose a novel pruning strategy to...
articles.author: Jaeheun Jung, Jaehyuk Lee, Yeajin Lee, Donghun Lee

articles.title: Self-Improving Language Models for Evolutionary Program Synthesis: A Case Study on ARC-AGI
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14172v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Many program synthesis tasks prove too challenging for even state-of-the-art language models to solve in single attempts. Search-based evolutionary methods offer a promising alternative by exploring solution spaces iteratively, but their effectiveness remain limited by the fixed capabilities of the underlying generative model. We propose SOAR, a method that learns program synthesis by integrating language models into a self-improving evolutionary...
articles.author: Julien Pourcel, C\'edric Colas, Pierre-Yves Oudeyer
articles.content: arXiv:2507.14172v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Many program synthesis tasks prove too challenging for even state-of-the-art language models to solve in single attempts. We propose SOAR, a method that learns program synthesis by integrating language models into a self-improving evolutionary...

articles.title: Latent Space Data Fusion Outperforms Early Fusion in Multimodal Mental Health Digital Phenotyping Data
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14175v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Background: Mental illnesses such as depression and anxiety require improved methods for early detection and personalized intervention. Traditional predictive models often rely on unimodal data or early fusion strategies that fail to capture the complex, multimodal nature of psychiatric data. Advanced integration techniques, such as intermediate (latent space) fusion, may offer better accuracy and clinical utility. Methods: Using data from the...

articles.title: Domain Generalization via Pareto Optimal Gradient Matching
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14227v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this study, we address the gradient-based domain generalization problem, where predictors aim for consistent gradient directions across different domains. Existing methods have two main challenges. First, minimization of gradient empirical distance or gradient inner products (GIP) leads to gradient fluctuations among domains, thereby hindering straightforward learning. Second, the direct application of gradient learning to the joint loss...

articles.title: Geometry-Aware Active Learning of Pattern Rankings via Choquet-Based Aggregation
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14217v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We address the pattern explosion problem in pattern mining by proposing an interactive learning framework that combines nonlinear utility aggregation with geometry-aware query selection. Our method models user preferences through a Choquet integral over multiple interestingness measures and exploits the geometric structure of the version space to guide the selection of informative comparisons. A branch-and-bound strategy with tight distance bounds...
articles.author: Tudor Matei Opran, Samir Loudni

Our method models user preferences through a Choquet integral over multiple interestingness measures and exploits the geometric structure of the version space to guide the selection of informative comparisons. articles.title: LaCache: Ladder-Shaped KV Caching for Efficient Long-Context Modeling of Large Language Models
articles.description: arXiv:2507.14204v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have spurred interest in numerous applications requiring robust long-range capabilities, essential for processing extensive input contexts and continuously generating extended outputs. As sequence lengths increase, the number of Key-Value (KV) pairs in LLMs escalates, creating a significant efficiency bottleneck. In this paper, we propose a new KV cache optimization paradigm called LaCache, a...
